titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1190: Societas Sanctae Annae per Poloniam, Lithuaniam, Russiam, et alias sancti? regis Poloniae ditiones instituta

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: On detached gathering, signed printed letter from Archbishop of Lviv Jan Dymitr Solikowski to the new Society of Saint Anne in Malogoszcz, Poland, with handwritten section by Archbishop of Gniezno Jan Wezyk added in 1634, when he was Primate of Poland and interrex, bearing wax seals by both Wezyk and Solikowski. Bound charter of Society of St. Anne, with articles in Polish, and Latin and Polish prayers. Following are catalogs of the men of the Society (including men's and women's names), members who died, and the women of the Society. Includes 10 scraps of paper with names and towns.
msContents.textLang: Latin, with articles and prayers in Polish

msItem.title: Societas Sanctae Annae per Poloniam, Lithuaniam, Russiam, et alias sancti? regis Poloniae ditiones instituta
Societas Sanctae Annae, in oppido Malogosscz, f. 2r
Societas Sanctae Annae. Per Poloniam, Lithuaniam, Russiam, & alias S. Regis Poloniae ditiones instituta, f. 4r
Catalogus Fratrum Societatis Sanctae Annae in Malogoscz, Anno Domini 1595, f. 15r
Catalogus Fratrum ex hac in illam vitam commigrantium, f. 36v
Catalogus Sororum Societatis Sanctae Annae, Anno Domini 1595, f. 38r

support.watermark: Crescent on two-legged table (for example f. 1, 2); monogrammed S in circular coat of arms (f. 13, 14); crown over heart-shaped coat of arms (f. 25, 28); hourglass-like figure surrounded by oval coat of arms (f. 39, 41).

supportDesc.extent: 48 leaves : 295 x 190 mm. bound to 300 x 200 mm. +
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 48; [1-48]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto; some contemporary pagination in ink, upper outer corners 3-18 (f. 5r-13v).

layoutDesc.layout: In brothers' catalog, entries for 1595-1619 in 2 columns with vertical bounding lines in ink. In catalog of deceased members, 3 columns with vertical bounding lines in ink. In sisters' catalog, 2 columns with vertical bounding lines in ink throughout.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in various cursive scripts, with some headings in calligraphic bookhands.

decoDesc.decoNote: In the printed text, initials of new sections illustrated with leaves and some figures. Pen-flourished initials in catalogs. Coat of arms of Solikowski (f. 4v). Engraving of Mary, Jesus and St. Anne (f. 4r).
Engraving, Virgin and Child with St. Anne, f. 4r

binding.p: Late 16th-century vellum (Zacour-Hirsch), with remnants of two leather straps on upper and lower covers.

origin.p: Written in Malogoszcz, 1595-1833. Charter and letter printed in Kraków, 1590 and 1595.
